page.title: 02SCHOOL DINNERS
page.content: Muir Street Primary School Dinner Hall is a small, stone-floored Building just across the road from the School. Today, June 7th 1985,{120}children had free lunches and{5}paid for theirs. A school dinner costs{58p,}which is an increase of 3p since the Easter. Children get free meals if their parents are unemployed or on a low income. The Dinner Hall is supervised by Mr. Macgregor, Headteacher, Mrs Nelson, Assistant Headteacher, and Mrs Baillie, the Auxiliary. Muir Street Kitchen provides meals for several other schools as well as Muir Street. The meals are kept warm in special containers and are delivered to the other schools by van.
